segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 4
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 4

segments.pli: 8. Apaṇṇakavagga
segments.en: 8. Guaranteed

segments.pli: 73. Sappurisasutta
segments.en: 73. A Good Person

segments.pli: “Catūhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato asappuriso veditabbo.
segments.en: “Mendicants, a bad person can be known by four qualities.

segments.pli: Katamehi catūhi?
segments.en: What four?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, asappuriso yo hoti parassa avaṇṇo taṃ apuṭṭhopi pātu karoti, ko pana vādo puṭṭhassa.
segments.en: To start with, a bad person speaks ill of another even when not asked, let alone when asked.

segments.pli: Puṭṭho kho pana pañhābhinīto ahāpetvā alambitvā paripūraṃ vitthārena parassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti.
segments.en: But when led on by questions they speak ill of another in full detail, not leaving anything out.

segments.pli: Veditabbametaṃ, bhikkhave, asappuriso ayaṃ bhavanti.
segments.en: That’s how to know that this is a bad person.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, asappuriso yo hoti parassa vaṇṇo taṃ puṭṭhopi na pātu karoti, ko pana vādo apuṭṭhassa.
segments.en: Furthermore, a bad person doesn’t speak well of another even when asked, let alone when not asked.

segments.pli: Puṭṭho kho pana pañhābhinīto hāpetvā lambitvā aparipūraṃ avitthārena parassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti.
segments.en: But when led on by questions they speak well of another without giving the full details, leaving many things out.

segments.pli: Veditabbametaṃ, bhikkhave, asappuriso ayaṃ bhavanti.
segments.en: That’s how to know that this is a bad person.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, asappuriso yo hoti attano avaṇṇo taṃ puṭṭhopi na pātu karoti, ko pana vādo apuṭṭhassa.
segments.en: Furthermore, a bad person doesn’t speak ill of themselves even when asked, let alone when not asked.

segments.pli: Puṭṭho kho pana pañhābhinīto hāpetvā lambitvā aparipūraṃ avitthārena attano avaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti.

segments.en: That’s how to know that this is a bad person.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, asappuriso yo hoti attano vaṇṇo taṃ apuṭṭhopi pātu karoti, ko pana vādo puṭṭhassa.
segments.en: Furthermore, a bad person speaks well of themselves even when not asked, let alone when asked.

segments.pli: Puṭṭho kho pana pañhābhinīto ahāpetvā alambitvā paripūraṃ vitthārena attano vaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti.
segments.en: But when led on by questions they speak well of themselves in full detail, not leaving anything out.

segments.pli: Veditabbametaṃ, bhikkhave, asappuriso ayaṃ bhavanti.
segments.en: That’s how to know that this is a bad person.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, catūhi dhammehi samannāgato asappuriso veditabbo.
segments.en: A bad person can be known by these four qualities.

segments.pli: Catūhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato sappuriso veditabbo.
segments.en: A good person can be known by four qualities.

segments.pli: Katamehi catūhi?
segments.en: What four?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, sappuriso yo hoti parassa avaṇṇo taṃ puṭṭhopi na pātu karoti, ko pana vādo apuṭṭhassa.
segments.en: To start with, a good person doesn’t speak ill of another even when asked, let alone when not asked.

segments.pli: Puṭṭho kho pana pañhābhinīto hāpetvā lambitvā aparipūraṃ avitthārena parassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti.
segments.en: But when led on by questions they speak ill of another without giving the full details, leaving many things out.

segments.pli: Veditabbametaṃ, bhikkhave, sappuriso ayaṃ bhavanti.
segments.en: That’s how to know that this is a good person.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, sappuriso yo hoti parassa vaṇṇo taṃ apuṭṭhopi pātu karoti, ko pana vādo puṭṭhassa.
segments.en: Furthermore, a good person speaks well of another even when not asked, let alone when asked.

segments.en: But when led on by questions they speak well of another in full detail, not leaving anything out.

segments.en: Furthermore, a good person speaks ill of themselves even when not asked, let alone when asked.

segments.en: That’s how to know that this is a good person.

segments.en: Furthermore, a good person doesn’t speak well of themselves even when asked, let alone when not asked.

segments.pli: Puṭṭho kho pana pañhābhinīto hāpetvā lambitvā aparipūraṃ avitthārena attano vaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti.
segments.en: But when led on by questions they speak well of themselves without giving the full details, leaving many things out.

segments.pli: Veditabbametaṃ, bhikkhave, sappuriso ayaṃ bhavanti.
segments.en: That’s how to know that this is a good person.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, catūhi dhammehi samannāgato sappuriso veditabbo.
segments.en: A good person can be known by these four qualities.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, vadhukā yaññadeva rattiṃ vā divaṃ vā ānītā hoti, tāvadevassā tibbaṃ hirottappaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti sassuyāpi sasurepi sāmikepi antamaso dāsakammakaraporisesu.
segments.en: It’s like a bride on the day or night she’s first brought to her husband’s home. Right away she sets up a keen sense of conscience and prudence for her mother and father in law, her husband, and even the bondservants, workers, and staff.

segments.pli: Sā aparena samayena saṃvāsamanvāya vissāsamanvāya sassumpi sasurampi sāmikampi evamāha:
segments.en: But after some time, because of living together and familiarity, she’ll even say to her mother and father in law, or to her husband:

segments.pli: ‘apetha, kiṃ pana tumhe jānāthā’ti.
segments.en: ‘Go away! What would you know?’

segments.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, idhekacco bhikkhu yaññadeva rattiṃ vā divaṃ vā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito hoti, tāvadevassa tibbaṃ hirottappaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti bhikkhūsu bhikkhunīsu upāsakesu upāsikāsu antamaso ārāmikasamaṇuddesesu.
segments.en: In the same way, on the day or night a mendicant first goes forth from the lay life to homelessness, right away they set up a keen sense of conscience and prudence for the monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen, and even the monastery workers and novices.

segments.pli: So aparena samayena saṃvāsamanvāya vissāsamanvāya ācariyampi upajjhāyampi evamāha:
segments.en: But after some time, because of living together and familiarity, they’ll even say to their teacher or mentor:

segments.pli: ‘apetha, kiṃ pana tumhe jānāthā’ti.
segments.en: ‘Go away! What would you know?’

segments.pli: Tasmātiha, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ:
segments.en: So you should train like this:

segments.pli: ‘adhunāgatavadhukāsamena cetasā viharissāmā’ti.
segments.en: ‘We will live with hearts like that of a newly wedded bride.’

segments.pli: Evañhi vo, bhikkhave, sikkhitabban”ti.
segments.en: That’s how you should train.”

segments.pli: Tatiyaṃ.
